lines.text: [the kid approaches Freddy Krueger around the pool, standing up for the other frightened kids]

[holding his hands up, walking to Freddy]
Just tell us what you want, all right? I'm here to help you.
Help yourself, fucker!
[as Freddy slices his shoulder and throws him against the flaming barbecue pit]
[Freddy walks at Lisa who has a knife]
Jesse, help.

[Freddy yells]
There is no Jesse. I'm Jesse now!
Get away from me! Get away from me!

[Freddy speaks in Jesse's voice]
Kill me, Lisa. Please, kill me.

[Freddy laughs, screaming]
Come on, Lisa. Kill him - Kill him!

[Lisa begins to stab Freddy's shoulder, as Freddy chuckles, talking in Jesse's voice]
I love you, Lisa.
[Freddy speaks to Jesse for the first time in Jesse's nightmare]

[Freddy runs the knives of his glove over Jesse's head]
I need you, Jesse. We got special work to do here, you and me.

[Freddy then slams Jesse against the wall, slowly tilting his head to him]
You've got the body...

[Freddy takes off his hat and digs his own fingers into his skull]
I've got the brain.

[Freddy then tears back the flesh on his head exposing the top of his brain, as Jesse screams]
Ahhhh!
[Freddy laughs wildly as Jesse wakes up screaming]
[Jesse and Ron run on the school track as Coach Schneider hears them from the sidelines]
Hey, Grady, do you remember your dreams?
Only the wet ones.
No talking!
[Freddy looks at the kids around the pool with his arms out, the gas flame from the barbecue pit blazing behind him]
You are all my children now.
[Jesse goes to Lisa's house, telling her that Freddy Krueger is inside his body]
Jesse, who is doing this to you?
Fred Krueger! He's inside me, and he wants to take me again!
No - No - Jesse? Jesse, this is not happening. It's got to be everything you've taken in - Schneider, the diary, the glove, only it's all mixed up.
Christ - What do I have to do to make you understand me? Last night he made me try and kill my sister.

[Jesse holds out his bloody hands]
I got blood on my hands.

[Jesse shivers, crying]
He owns me.
[Jesse finds Freddy Krueger's glove inside of his home's basement boiler]

[as Freddy appears from behind the boiler]
Go ahead, Jesse. Try it on for size.
[Jesse throws down the steel glove]

[Freddy puts his hand on the basement boiler as it sizzles]
Kill for me!
[Lisa finds Nancy's diary in Jesse's closet and reads the first page]

'Sometimes when I'm lying here in bed, I can see Glenn in the window across the way getting ready for bed. His body is slim and smooth, and I know I shouldn't watch him, but that part of me that wants him forces me to. That's when I weaken. That's when I want to go to him.'
Can I see that?

[Jesse begins to read the next page in the diary]
'March 15th - He comes to me at night, horrible, ugly, and dirty, under the sheets with me, tearing at my night gown with his steel claw.'

[Jesse silently flips the page]
'His name is Fred. And he keeps trying to take me to the boiler room. He wants to kill me.'

[Jesse flips the page, remaining silent]
What is it?

[Jesse hands the diary back over to Lisa, as she reads]
'Tina is dead.' Jesse are you okay?
It's just something that Grady said... about the girl that used to live here. How she went crazy when she saw her boyfriend get murdered across the street.
[Lisa forces Jesse to try and fight Freddy from taking over his body]
Jesse, fight him!

[Jesse stands up]
I can't!

[the house window shuts and locks itself]
Fight it, Jesse!

[the front door closes and locks itself]
You created him. You can destroy him! He is living off of your fear - Jesse, fight him.

[Jesse yells out]
I can't!
Yes you can. Fight him! You are not afraid of him! He doesn't even exist!

[the TV and fish tank explode as Lisa screams]
No!
[we see the view of something coming out from the basement, moving through the house, up the stairs, as Jesse enters into Angela's bedroom]

[Freddy's voice speaks down to Angela in her bed]
Wake up, little girl.

[Angela wakes up from sleeping and turns over, asking half asleep]
What time is it?

[seeing Jesse stand over her wearing Freddy's glove]
It's late. Go back to sleep.
[Jesse tries to hold Freddy behind the basement door when he calls out for his dad]
Dad! Help!

[Jesse turns to run away when Freddy appears, standing behind him]
Daddy can't help you now!
[Jesse tells Ron that something is inside of him and it's trying to get out]
There's something inside of me. And last night it made me go in to my sister's room. And tonight with Lisa in the cabana, it started happening again.
I think you are seriously losing it, bro.
I'm scared, Grady. Something is trying to get inside my body.
Yeah, and she's female, and she's waiting for you in the cabana. And you wanna sleep with me.
[Jesse and Ron talk in the locker room about Coach Schneider]
You know, Schneider shouldn't have called you out on that last play.
Yeah, well, Schneider's got a stick up his ass today.

[Jesse chuckles]
Schneider's always got a stick up his ass.
Hello, dirtballs.
[Ken and Cheryl Walsh argue about what help Jesse needs]
He needs professional help. I think we have to take him to see a psychiatrist.
Oh, come on, Cheryl. You're out of your gourd. What the hell will that do?
I don't know. I just feel he needs help, and we don't know how to give it to him.
Oh, come on, Cheryl.
Are you hearing me? That boy's in trouble!
No, he's not in trouble! What that boy needs is a good goddamn kick in the butt, that's what he needs! Tell you what he needs. He needs a methadone clinic.
[last lines]

[Jesse sits on the bus with Lisa and Kerry, as the bus hits a bump]
What is this? Am I going crazy, or is this bus going too fast?
It's going fine.
No problem.

[the bus begins to pick up speed]
No - This bus is going too fast. Lisa, it's starting to speed up.
It's fine.

[Jesse yells out to the bus driver]
Driver - Driver, stop!

[the bus slows down, as Jesse see's another kid get on]
I'm sorry. I'm sorry.
It's okay - It's all right.
Jesse, it's okay. It's all over.
[as Freddy's hand rips through the front shirt of Kerry, the bus is shown driving out in the deserted field, hearing the screams of the kids on the bus and Freddy's laughter]
[Lisa looks over for Jesse on the floor as she hears Freddy's laugh]
Jesse?

[Freddy stands up, scratching his steel claws on the desk, walking over to Lisa]
He can't fight me. I'm him.
[Jesse takes Lisa to school in his cheap car and starts it up by the wires for the car radio]
Don't you ever use a key?
Why?
Well, somebody could steal your car, couldn't they?

[Jesse smiles asking back to her]
The deadly dinosaur?
[Jesse arrives to school as Ron tells him about Coach Schneider being murdered]

[Ron stops Jesse outside the yellow tape]
Yo, man. Where have you been? Schneider got wasted last night. He must have been working late. Some maniac came in and sliced him up like a kielbasa, hacked him in the shower. Got bloody footprints all over the place.
[Jesse asks his father about their house during the family's morning breakfast]
Dad, how come it took them five years to sell this house?
Oh, I don't know. Just couldn't get the right price, I suppose.
You didn't know anything about the murder across the street, and the crazy girl who lived here that saw the whole thing?
They told me something about it, yeah, but I...
You mean, you knew something about this, and you...
Oh, come on, Cheryl. How do think we got such a good deal, huh?
Did they tell you that that girl lost her mind, and her mother killed herself in our living room?

[Cheryl yells out louder]
What?
Did they tell you that?
Mom, I'm scared.

[Ken signals for Angela to come to him]
Come here.

[Cheryl tells her daughter]
Oh, honey, it's all right. Daddy and Jesse are just pretending, that's all. I don't think this is something we should discuss here.

[Ken tells Jesse]
See what you're doing here? I don't want to hear one more word about it, Jess. There is absolutely nothing, I mean *nothing*, wrong with this house. Come on.
Something burning?
[the Walsh family downstairs hear the sound of Jesse waking up by screaming]
Mommy? Why can't Jesse wake up like everybody else?
Oh, honey, he's all right. He's just having a bad dream.
[first lines]

[a student tells another student to turn his boombox down by throwing a paper at his head]
Turn it down!
[a girl on the bus tries to get the bus driver's attention when he doesn't stop at her drop off]
Hey, driver, that was my stop. Driver that was my stop!
[as the bus drives into a deserted field, bouncing through the hills of dirt with the students in the back]
[Jesse joins his parents for morning breakfast, as Angela digs in a cereal box for the toy prize]
Jesse, are you okay?
It's just so hot up there. I'm having a lot of trouble sleeping.
I know - Ken, I wish you'd call somebody and have the air conditioning...
There's nothing, absolutely nothing wrong with that air conditioning, mom. It just needs a shot of Freon.

[Angela finds the toy prize]
Here they are!
Oh, no. Come on, dad, you're not trying to fix something again.

[Ken smiles]
Nobody likes a smart ass, buddy boy.

[Angela holds up her hand wearing the Freddy look-alike Fu Man fingers]
Look.
[Jesse gets hit in the head with a soft ball, as Coach Schneider goes onto the field to check on him]
You okay?
Yeah, I'm fine.
Well, pay attention next time!
[Jesse and Ron do push-ups out in the sun side-by-side, as Ron asks him about Lisa]
So, what about you and that rich babe you've been cruising to school with every day.
What about her?
Are you mounting her lightly or what?
[Ron tells Jesse about the house Jesse just moved into]
So, you live around here or what?
Yeah, my parents just bought a place on Elm Street.
Elm Street? You telling me you moved in that big white house with bars in the window?
Yeah, what about it?
Shit. You can tell your old man's a real chump.
What are you talking about now, Grady?
Some chick was locked in there by her mother and she went crazy. She watched her boyfriend get butchered across the street by some maniac.
You're full of shit, Grady.
[the students listen to their biology teacher talk about the human digestive system]
So, to review... the solid waste, those nutrients not absorbed by the lining of the stomach, the large intestine, the small intestine, and the alimentary canal, are passed down through the colon.
[Ron makes a farting sound as the rest of the students chuckle]
Liquid nutrients are then carried through an elaborate system of filtering, aided by the pancreas, liver, and gall bladder or collected in the gall bladder to be expelled at a later time.
[another student makes a gagging sound as the students laugh some more]
And, this entire process has kept moving through the circulatory system... the center of which is...

[the biology teacher drops a human heart on the desk]
The heart.

[Ron yells out]
Yeah!
[Jesse wakes up from a nightmare in class and screams in his biology class as a snake wraps itself around him]

[the teacher removes the snake off Jesse]
If you want to play with animals, Mr. Walsh, join the circus.
[the students all laugh]
[Jesse and the family talk about how hot it is in the living room]
My, God - It is hot like an oven in here.
Shh! The birds are sleeping.
Cheryl, it's 97 degrees in here.
[Ken Walsh tries to check behind the oven for a gas leak, and if it was the cause of the family bird to explode]
It isn't the gas.
Don't tell me it's not the gas. Your mother thought she smelled gas.
Well, Ken, I thought I did. I wasn't sure.
All right, then. What is it? I mean, bird rabies? It's that cheap seed you been buying.
Oh, please, Ken. Really...
Well, it could be. There's got to be a reasonable explanation. I mean, animals don't just explode into flames for no reason. Do they?
[the policeman drops Jesse off at home to his parents late in the night]

[Jesse's parents answer the door]
Good evening. Does this belong to you?

[the parents see Jesse standing there with a blanket around him]
Yes, sir - He's my son.
We found him out on the highway, wandering around. He was naked. I'd keep a short leash on him, if I were you.
[Jesse's parents question him after arriving home with the police naked]
Two questions. You answer them, and we can all go to bed, all right? What are you taking, son? Who are you getting it from?
I'm not taking drugs. Mom, I want to go to bed.
[Jesse walks to his sister Angela's bedroom after hearing Freddy's voice tell him to kill]

[Jesse opens the door to see Angela in a dress jump roping, singing]
One, Two / Freddy's coming for you / Three, Four / Better lock your door / Five, Six / Grab your crucifix
[Lisa takes Jesse to the burned down power plant that Freddy Krueger used to work at]
Freddy Krueger kidnapped 20 kids and brought them here... and killed them.

[Jesse looks around the burned down building]
Do you feel anything?
What do you mean?
I don't know. I thought you might be able to make a connection or something.

[Jesse tries to concentrate]
I feel like a jerk.
[Jesse drives Lisa to school as she asks him if he's okay]
You had another nightmare, didn't you?
Yes, I had a bad night.
Do you want to talk about it?
My dad thinks I'm on drugs. My mom thinks I'm crazy. And, you know, at this point, I don't know if I don't disagree with her.
[Kerry looks back at Jesse and asks Lisa in the cafeteria line]
Hey, what's wrong with Jesse? He seems kinda freaked out.
[Kerry asks Ron at the school cafeteria table about going to Lisa's party]
Hi, Ronnie. So, you going to Lisa's house tomorrow night?
Nope - Can't - I'm grounded.
How come?
I threw my grandmother down a flight of stairs.
[Lisa tries to talk to Jesse around the school cafeteria table]
I wish you would talk to me. You know, we can figure it out. We can figure it out together.
There is nothing to figure out.

[Ron butts in with a full mouth of food]
I don't know why you're wasting your time with this guy. He's a basket case.

[Jesse yells out]
Shup up, Grady!

[Ron continues to talk with a full mouth of food before getting up to walk away]
You want me to shut up? Fine! I'll shut up. No problem!
[Jesse sits with Ron in his bedroom, asking Ron for help]
I need you to help me. Okay?
All right, man. What do you want me to do?

Just watch me. And if anything starts to happen - If I start to act weird, or start dreaming weird, or try to walk out of here, you gotta stop me. I don't care if you have to hit me over the head, just don't let me leave. And, Grady... don't fall asleep.
[Lisa talks to Kerry beside the pool]
I don't know, Kerry. I feel like I should go see him, but I can't just leave the party.

[Kerry scoffs]
Fuck the party. Go see him.

[Lisa smiles before kissing Kerry's cheek]
Yeah.
[Lisa reads the last page of Nancy's diary to Jesse]
Jesse. Come on - I just want you to listen to this. It's something Nancy said in the last page of her diary. Listen.
'He is evil itself. I know now that I brought him into my world. We all did. Gave him all the energy he needed. Our screams were all he needed.'
[Lisa tries to set Jesse free from Freddy with her love for Jesse]
Come back to me, Lisa.

[Freddy chuckles]
I am not afraid of you.

[Freddy laughs]
He's in there, and I want him back! I'm going to take him away from you, and you are gonna go straight back to hell you son of a bitch!
No, Jesse's dead.
Come back to me, Jesse. I love you. Come back to me.

[Freddy screams]
He's dead!
He can't hold you, Jesse. He's losing his grip. You can get out.

[Freddy weakens to his knees]
He'll die with me. He'll die with both of us.
[Lisa leans in to kiss Freddy]
